BREAKING: IRCC to remove LMIA-based job offer points from Express Entry Comprehensive Ranking System - Canada Immigration News
summary:
IRCC to Remove LMIA Job Offer Points from Express Entry

Published on: December 17, 2024 | Source: CIC News

Express Entry candidates seeking Canadian permanent residency will soon no longer receive additional points for having an LMIA-based job offer, a change announced by Immigration Minister Marc Miller.

  • Before this update, candidates could gain 50 or 200 additional points for LMIA job offers.
  • This change is expected to impact candidates' chances of receiving an invitation to apply for permanent residency.
  • The exact implementation date of this change is still unclear.
  • Changes are part of broader immigration reforms aimed at reducing fraud and enforcing program integrity.
“We will be implementing further measures that reinforce the program and reduce the potential for LMIA fraud.” - Immigration Minister Marc Miller

This development marks a significant shift in the Express Entry Comprehensive Ranking System, which scores candidates based on various factors, impacting their residency application prospects.
newTitle: IRCC to Remove LMIA Job Offer Points from Express Entry

title: Over 50% increase in Indians studying abroad: Govt Data - Hindustan Times
summary:
Over 50% Increase in Indians Studying Abroad: Government Data

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The number of Indians studying abroad has seen a significant increase of 52.2% from 2019 to 2023, with notable growth in Canada, the USA, and the UK despite ongoing diplomatic tensions.

  • Indian students abroad rose from 586,337 in 2019 to 892,989 in 2023.
  • The largest student population is in the USA (234,473), followed closely by Canada (233,532) and the UK (136,921).
  • Canada experienced a 76% increase in Indian students despite diplomatic issues between the two countries.
  • The US saw a 91% rise, while the UK had a dramatic 273.9% increase in Indian student enrollment.
  • This trend reflects students' choices influenced by study and work opportunities abroad.
“Higher studies abroad are a matter of individual will and choice. The Government recognises the reality of a global workplace.” - Sukanta Majumdar

In conclusion, the data indicates a growing trend among Indians to pursue education abroad, driven by better opportunities despite international challenges.
newTitle: Over 50% Increase in Indians Studying Abroad: Government Data

title: Biden breaks silence on mystery drone sightings after Trump's scathing allegations - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biden Responds to Drone Sightings After Trump's Allegations

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

President Biden addressed the recent controversy surrounding mysterious drone sightings in the US, stating there is 'nothing nefarious' about them.

  • Biden assured that authorities are closely monitoring drone sightings.
  • The statement was made after Trump accused the government of a cover-up regarding the drone issue.
  • Trump claimed the military is aware of the drones' origins and expressed frustration at the lack of transparency.
  • Officials confirmed that many of the reported sightings are attributed to lawful commercial, hobbyist, and law enforcement drones.
“Nothing nefarious, apparently, but they’re checking it all out,” - President Biden.

Biden's comments provide reassurance amid public speculation and controversy, echoing statements from various government agencies regarding the nature of drone sightings.
newTitle: Biden Responds to Drone Sightings After Trump's Allegations

title: Masterstroke by PM Modi, India strengthens ties with North Korea, opens embassy in…, as world remains busy in - India.com
summary:
India Resumes Embassy Operations in North Korea Amid Global Tensions

Published on: December 2024 | Source: India.com

At a time when the world focuses on conflicts in the Middle East and Europe, India is strengthening its Act East policy by reopening its embassy in North Korea after closing it for over three years.

  • India resumes diplomatic operations at its embassy in Pyongyang, which had been inactive since July 2021.
  • The closure was initially due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with staff recalled to New Delhi.
  • A new team of diplomatic personnel has been sent to North Korea following the embassy's reactivation.
  • India maintains a cautious approach toward North Korea due to its opaque governance and strategic military advancements.
  • North Korea's growing ties with Russia, China, and Iran necessitate India’s continued engagement in the region.
"Sustaining a presence in North Korea is crucial to prevent the proliferation of technologies to Pakistan or other rogue actors."

India's decision to resume operations in North Korea highlights its commitment to regional diplomacy, ensuring it remains relevant amid changing geopolitical dynamics.
newTitle: India Resumes Embassy Operations in North Korea Amid Global Tensions

title: Have you seen US President-elect Donald Trump's new hairstyle? Video goes viral - India Today
summary:
Donald Trump's New Hairstyle Goes Viral Ahead of Presidency

Published On: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: India Today

A video showing US President-elect Donald Trump sporting a noticeably different hairstyle has gone viral on social media.

  • The clip features Trump at his private property, the Trump International Gold Club in West Palm Beach, Florida, warmly greeting a roaring crowd.
  • The viral video sparked comments about a potential makeover ahead of his presidency.
  • Trump is set to take office at the presidential inauguration on January 20, 2025.
  • He won the 2024 US presidential election with 295 electoral votes, defeating Kamala Harris, who secured 226 electoral votes.
  • Trump became the first leader in over a century to serve non-consecutive terms since Grover Cleveland and the oldest person elected to office at 78.
“Donald Trump became the first leader in over a century to serve non-consecutive terms since Grover Cleveland’s re-election in 1892.”

This viral moment highlights the ever-present public interest in Trump's persona and his upcoming political journey.
newTitle: Donald Trump's New Hairstyle Goes Viral Ahead of Presidency

title: ‘Scenes of hell’: Crocodile emerges from water with lifeless body of housewife after killing her in 'death roll' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Tragic Crocodile Attack Leaves Housewife Dead in Sumatra

Date & Source: Dec 18, 2024 03:04 PM IST, Hindustan Times

A 46-year-old woman in Sumatra, Indonesia, was killed by a crocodile while washing her feet at a waterbody. The crocodile dragged her underwater and resurfaced with her lifeless body an hour later.

  1. The woman was attacked and dragged underwater by a crocodile.
  2. The crocodile resurfaced with the woman's lifeless body an hour later.
  3. Locals used chickens to distract the crocodile and retrieve the body.
  4. The crocodile was later captured and killed.
  5. Authorities expressed concerns about the threat posed by crocodiles in the area.
"Her blood was spilling into the water." - Agustinus, eyewitness

The incident has raised concerns about the safety of residents living near coastal areas in Sumatra.
newTitle: Tragic Crocodile Attack Leaves Housewife Dead in Sumatra

title: Was Wisconsin school shooter Natalie Rupnow transgender? Police chief says ‘it’s something that may…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Wisconsin School Shooting: Police Chief Addresses Transgender Rumors About Natalie Rupnow

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The police chief investigating the shooting at Abundant Life Christian School responded to claims regarding the shooter, 15-year-old Natalie Rupnow's gender identity, deeming it irrelevant to the incident.

  • Rupnow carried out a shooting at the school, killing one student and a teacher.
  • Six others were injured during the incident.
  • Police Chief Shon Barnes emphasized the importance of focusing on the community's loss rather than unverified claims about Rupnow's gender.
  • Rupnow reportedly had disturbing online posts related to school shootings.
  • There is an ongoing investigation into the potential factors behind the shooting, including any bullying incidents.
“I wish people would leave their own personal biases. We have lost members of our community.” - Police Chief Shon Barnes

The police continue to investigate Rupnow's online activity and potential motives behind the tragic shooting incident.
newTitle: Wisconsin School Shooting: Police Chief Addresses Transgender Rumors About Natalie Rupnow

title: H-1B visa revamp: What employers and students need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
H-1B visa revamp: What employers and students need to know

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Biden administration has announced reforms to the H-1B visa program aimed at streamlining the application process and curbing abuses within the system.

  • The new rules will take effect on January 17, 2025, requiring a new application form, I-129.
  • Applicants must show that their degree field is directly relevant to the job tied to the visa.
  • Immigration officials can defer to prior approvals for extension requests, streamlining renewals.
  • The USCIS gains enhanced authority for workplace inspections to ensure compliance with H-1B regulations.
  • Filing fees remain substantial: $780 for paper submissions and $730 for online, while small employers and nonprofits face a reduced fee of $460.
“These updates aim to make the H-1B process more efficient and ensure it meets the needs of our evolving economy.” - DHS

This overhaul could have a lasting impact on the program and how international students and professionals navigate the visa process.
newTitle: H-1B Visa Revamp: Key Changes for Employers and Students

title: Igor Kirillov death: Russia says Uzbek citizen suspect detained in killing of general in Moscow - The Hindu
summary:
Igor Kirillov death: Russia says Uzbek citizen suspect detained in killing of general in Moscow

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: The Hindu

On December 17, 2024, Lt. General Igor Kirillov was killed by a bomb hidden in a scooter outside his apartment in Moscow. A suspect, identified as an Uzbek citizen, has been detained by Russian authorities.

  • The detained suspect reportedly confessed to being recruited by Ukrainian intelligence services.
  • Kirillov was under international sanctions for his actions during the conflict in Ukraine.
  • The attack has been categorized as terrorism, and Russian authorities have vowed to respond accordingly.
  • Images from the bombing site depict significant damage, with shattered windows reported.
“His assistant also died in the attack.”

This incident underscores the ongoing tensions between Russia and Ukraine, as allegations of chemical weapon use and international repercussions continue to mount.
newTitle: Detained Uzbek Suspect in Killing of Russian General Igor Kirillov
